title: 2020 in Retrospect: Career Edition
body:
*First published on LinkedIn, as seen [here](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6749993837302824960/):* 

As the year comes to an end, I would like to celebrate some of my career-related (and adjacent) highlights in 2020

- Got promoted to a Data Engineer at work and naturally, my work got a lot more technical this year.\
- Challenged myself to do a more self-paced version of [\#100DaysOfCode](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/hashtag/?keywords=100daysofcode&highlightedUpdateUrns=urn%3Ali%3Aactivity%3A6749993837302824960) from April to July. I did this challenge to further hone my modern web development skills. Got significantly better in web development and gave me confidence with my capabilities in this area.\
- I entered 3 hackathons this year and managed to win awards in all of them.\
- Launched my personal portfolio site back in June and have been diligently updating it with my involvements throughout the year.\
- Reconnected with my love and passion for startups and product-building. Got involved with the Malaysians Who Make community ( <https://lnkd.in/gqEv9Bb>) and been reading voraciously into the space. Maybe I'll launch my own micro-SaaS in future?\
- Spoke for a Fireside Chat event organised by PyData and got involved with the PyDataKL community. Hopefully I can continue contributing and interacting in that community.\
\
How does 2021 look like? Well, some plans are better left unspoken until its executed, no? Here's to the eventful year that is 2020.
description: Looking back into my career achievements in the (very challenging) year of 2020
